newsitem.title: USA: USDA says weekly corn export sales figure accurate.
newsitem.headline: USDA says weekly corn export sales figure accurate.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Department officials Thursday said the latest estimate of U.S. weekly corn export sales was accurate and the department had no intention of revising it.
"There's nothing that's wrong with the numbers we have released today," said a department official, who asked not to be identified.
Earlier, USDA reported U.S. net corn sales in the week ended April 3 were 929,500 tonnes, including 203,600 tonnes sold to Taiwan.
Traders said the Taiwan sales figure was too high given cutbacks in feed usuage due to an outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease among hogs on the island.
Department officials said there was nothing to indicate that their numbers were inflated.
They said if a mistake was uncovered, the department would not correct it until the next export sales report to be released April 10.
